title: Electric Vehicles and Charging Infrastructure for Decarbonisation of Land Transportation | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: Learn about sustainable transportation systems and technologies, while delving into electric vehicles and their associated infrastructure.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Electric Vehicles and Charging Infrastructure for Decarbonisation of Land Transportation
Electric Vehicles and Charging Infrastructure for Decarbonisation of Land Transportation
Learn about sustainable transportation systems and technologies, while delving into electric vehicles and their associated infrastructure.
Transport Engineering, Sustainability, Energy Efficiency, Executive Education

In line with  Singapore Green Plan's vision for a cleaner energy vehicle landscape by 2040, this 5-day course offers timely insights into current sustainable and green transportation trends, focusing on electric vehicles (EVs) and associated infrastructure.
Gain a comprehensive understanding of sustainable transportation systems, including their environmental impact, societal implications, and economic feasibility
Explore global trends and innovations in green transportation technologies, encompassing EVs, fuel cells, hydrogen, and alternative fuel vehicles
Examine the technical, economic, and social considerations in the adoption of sustainable transportation systems
Identify challenges and opportunities associated with implementation, and evaluate the key systems and components of EVs and fuel cells
Assess the performance and sustainability of batteries and charging infrastructure for EVs
Analyse the impact of EVs on the transportation of goods and people, and evaluate their integration with public transportation systems
Investigate the impact of autonomous vehicle technology on the future of transportation and mobility
Evaluate the advantages of EVs in supporting autonomous vehicle technology

By the end of the course, you will be well-versed in the intricacies of green transportation systems and EVs, enabling you to navigate the evolving landscape of sustainable transportation with confidence.
Transportation professionals, environmental advocates, and professionals interested in sustainable transportation and EVs
A degree or diploma in engineering or disciplines related to land transport, sustainability, energy, or the environment
Environmental impact of transportation: greenhouse emissions and pollution effects
Global trends and benefits of sustainable transportation systems: reduced environmental impact, improved health outcomes, and economic benefits
Sustainability considerations in EV adoption, including the role of renewable energy sources, sustainable materials, and responsible end-of-life disposal practices
Singapore’s long-term vision for the adoption of EVs and EVs infrastructure
Legislation and incentives for the adoption of EV: tax credits, rebates, and infrastructure investments
Challenges and solutions in electric vehicle system integration and deployment
Environmental impact of EV, including discussion of lifecycle analysis and the cradle-to-grave impact of EVs compared to traditional combustion engine vehicles
Opportunities and challenges in EVs adoption
The fundamental system-level design of EVs vs ICE vehicles
The integration of EVs with EVs charger systems
Overview of power electronics in EVs
Understanding the design and operation of power electronics
Discussion of the advancements and challenges associated with power electronics in EVs
Review of case studies and examples of successful deployment of EVs power electronics
Overview of electric motors in EVs
Understanding the design and operation of electric motors
Discussion of the advancements and challenges associated with electric motors in EV
Review of case studies and examples of successful deployment of EV electric motors
Understanding the design and operation of drivetrains
Discussion of the advancements and challenges associated with drivetrains in EVs
Review of case studies and examples of successful deployment of EV drivetrains
Overview of vehicle control systems in EVs
Understanding the design and operation of vehicle control systems
Discussion of the advancements and challenges associated with vehicle control systems in EV
Review of case studies and examples of successful deployment of EV control systems
Overview of battery chemistry and performance: lithium-ion batteries, solid-state batteries, and sodium-ion batteries
Factors affecting battery life and performance, including temperature, charging rate, and depth of discharge
Battery safety considerations, including thermal management and fire prevention
Overview of the latest developments in EV battery technology, including solid-state batteries, flow batteries, and lithium-sulfur batteries
Discussion of the benefits and challenges associated with these new technologies
Review of the latest research and development efforts aimed at improving the performance, safety, and sustainability of EV batteries
Sustainability considerations in battery manufacturing and end-of-life disposal
Strategies to promote the use of sustainable materials in EV batteries
Role of EV in the transportation of goods and people: passenger vehicles, commercial fleets, and public transportation
Challenges and opportunities associated with the electrification of heavy vehicles: battery capacity, charging infrastructure, and operating costs.
Integration of EVs in public transportation systems: electric buses, charging stations, and route planning
Sustainable transportation solutions for urban environments: micro-mobility, ride-sharing, and last-mile delivery
Overview of autonomous vehicle technology: sensor systems, machine learning, and control systems
Impact of autonomous vehicles on the future of transportation and mobility: reduced accidents, congestion, and energy consumption
Advantages of EVs in supporting autonomous vehicle technology: lower operating costs, reduced emissions, and quieter operation
Strategies to promote the adoption of autonomous EVs in urban environments: policy and regulatory frameworks, public-private partnerships, and infrastructure investments
Charging Infrastructure and Industry Visit (Hosted by Schneider Electric)
Types of EV Charging Methods, Including Level 1, Level 2, and DC Fast Charging
Understanding charging time and range anxiety
Comparison of different charging methods in terms of charging time and cost
The infrastructure required to support EV charging, including public charging stations, home charging stations, and workplace charging stations
Adverse impacts of charging infrastructure to the grid
Impact of charging infrastructure on the adoption of EVs
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Associate Professor Ng Bor Kiat brings with him close to 40 years of industry experiences and extensive involvements in research and development, system management, maintenance engineering and project management. 

He was previously the Chief Technology Officer and Senior Vice President at SMRT, Chief Maintenance & Engineering Officer of the Singapore Armed Forces and a Consultant to NUS Temasek Systems Institute. 

Bor Kiat holds a Master’s degree in Military Vehicle Technology from Cranfield Institute of Technology (UK) and a Bachelor of Engineering (Mechanical Engineering) degree from Tokyo Institute of Technology (Japan). He is a Chartered Engineer in Railway and Transportation Engineering and a Chartered Engineer in Systems Engineering conferred by the Institution of Engineers Singapore. He attended the Programme for Management Development Programme at Harvard University.
Professor/ Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Professor/ Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Rathore is a Professor of the Engineering faculty, at the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT). He is an expert in power electronics and control of electric motor drives and received the Gold Medal for securing the highest academic standing in his Master’s degree. Dr. Rathore is a recipient of many prestigious awards including the 2020 IEEE IAS Outstanding Area Chair Award, the 2020 IEEE Bimal Bose Award for   Industrial Electronics Applications in Energy Systems and the 2021 Nagamori Award. He has published about 285 research papers in international journals and conferences, including 96 IEEE TRANSACTIONS. His research is mainly focused on the analysis and design of novel current-fed converters (topologies and modulation), soft-switching design and modulation schemes for the dc/dc converters, pulsating DC link (electrolytic capacitorless) inverters, and control of multilevel inverters.
Associate Professor / Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor / Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Zheng Jianxin is an Associate Professor of the engineering cluster at Singapore Institute of Technology. Currently, he is also the Programme Leader for Electronics and Data Engineering programme. His current research interest is on semiconductor device physics and simulation, transport system simulation and data analytics. He holds a Bachelor of Engineering and Master of Engineering in Electrical & Electronics Engineering from the National University of Singapore (NUS), and PhD (Advanced Materials for Micro and Nano Systems) from Singapore-MIT Alliance in NUS.
Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Lock is a Professor (Engineering) at the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) and the Head of its Energy Efficiency Technology Centre. He plays an active role in energy efficiency and sustainability, being the Chairman of Accreditation Committee for Energy Service Companies (ESCOs) and the Co-Chair of Steering Committee of Singapore Certified Energy Managers (SCEM) Scheme. He is an

awarded by the Uptime Institute. He is a specialist consulting engineer in the areas of mission-critical electrical design, power quality, EMC, and safety. He conducted many power failure investigations of data centres.

Professor Lock has a unique blend of practicing and academic experience acquired through a career which is equally split between the industry and the academia. He received both his B.Sc. (1975) and Ph.D. (1979) degrees in Electrical Engineering from the University of Strathclyde, UK. He was a faculty at the Department of Electrical Engineering, National University of Singapore for 17 years when he left to set up his consulting practice in 1997. He returned to the academia as a professor at SIT in 2016 after 20 years in the industry.

He is a registered Professional Engineer (Electrical) and served as a Board Member of the Professional Engineers Board, Singapore for 14 years. He is a Fellow of Academy of Engineering Singapore and an Honorary Fellow of the ASEAN Federation of Engineering Organizations.

He is the co-Laureate of the 2021 WFEO Medal for Excellence in Engineering Education awarded by the World Federation of Engineering Organisations. He received the Public Service Medal (2015) and the Public Service Star (2020).

Stephanie is the CEO at EV-Electric (EVe) Charging Pte Ltd, a wholly owned subsidiary of the Land Transport Authority (LTA). Since EVe was formed in November 2022, we have been working hard to orchestrate the roll out of Singapore’s largest public EV charging infrastructure. We work with charging operators and the authorities to create charging experiences people love. Before joining the EVe family, Stephanie was director at the National Electric Vehicle Centre at the LTA. She had also previously worked in various other government agencies in the areas of finance, municipal services, and learning and development
Product Application Leader (Asia Pacific), Schneider Electric
Product Application Leader (Asia Pacific), Schneider Electric

Mr. Sin Jia Hau is a dedicated professional serving as the Product Application Leader (Asia Pacific) at Schneider Electric, a global leader in electric vehicle charger manufacturing and a global leader in the digital transformation of energy management and automation.

With nearly three years of experience in the eMobility industry, he has played a pivotal role in advancing the EV charging infrastructure, not only in Singapore but also across the Asia Pacific region, including Australia, Hong Kong, Thailand, Malaysia, and Vietnam. His contributions encompass providing comprehensive training, hosting forums, and delivering educational speeches to government agencies, building owners, consultants, and engineers. Jia Hau is committed to shaping this emerging market through knowledge dissemination and engagement.

He specialises in designing and delivering Electric Vehicle (EV) charging infrastructure, showcasing expertise in charging technologies, standards, and emerging trends. He is also well-versed in energy management solutions that optimise the EV charging process, improving building electricity stability. His proficiency in controlling the charging process allows for a reduction in electricity demand, particularly when power availability for the EV infrastructure is limited.

Before venturing into the e-mobility industry, he dedicated his career to building energy management and automation for more than 25 years, with a strong focus on energy management and sustainability. His efforts contributed significantly to the reduction of carbon emissions in the built environment.

Chan Cher Leong has more than 25 years of experience in automotive systems and work experience in government agencies and industries. Currently, he is the Director of Engineering at BYD Singapore. Prior to this, he had various portfolios and different capacities in SMRT, DSTA, and SAF Army Engineering.

He holds a master of science in mechanical engineering, industrial and systems engineering, safety, health, and environment technology from NUS. He also holds a bachelor of technology in mechanical engineering, second class upper honours from NUS, an advance diploma in mechatronics, and a diploma in mechanical engineering from Singapore Polytechnic. He is a member of the Institute of Engineers Singapore and is currently a member of the TR25 review committee.
Professor, Harbin University of Science and Technology
Professor, Harbin University of Science and Technology

Prof William CAI is a professor at Harbin University of Science and Technology (HUST) / Founder of Jing-Jin Electric (stock code 688280). Foreign academician of the Russian Academy of Engineering, Fellow of SAE International, Fellow of the China Society of Automotive Engineering (China SAE), Fellow of the Chinese Electrotechnical Society, Directors of the China EV100, China SAE and the Chinese Power Supply Society. He is the group head of the "New Energy e-Motor System and Key Materials Innovation Research" team of Heilongjiang Province in HUST, and the chief scientist of the Engineering Research Center of the State Education Ministry for Automotive Electronic Drive Control and System Integration. He has served as an Expert of the National Overall Group for China Key Projects of Energy-saving and New Energy Vehicles since 2021.

He got his PhD from Clarkson University in USA, has 18 years of academic experience, 20 years of industry experience, including full-time in European and American universities and industries, such as the University of Wisconsin-Madison in the United States, the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology-Zurich in Switzerland, Clarkson University in the United States, and Remy International Inc. in the United States for 14 years. He has achieved significant innovative achievements in the R&D, design, engineering, and application of new materials in electrical engineering, especially in new energy e-motors and power electronic systems, Including the invention of the globally leading "Hairpin" flat wire winding motor and the first application of oil cooled motor systems in China.
Technical Director, Singapore Battery Consortium and Deputy Executive Director, IMRE & A*STAR
Technical Director, Singapore Battery Consortium and Deputy Executive Director, IMRE & A*STAR

Dr. Chiam Sing Yang is currently the Deputy Executive Director of Institute of Materials Research and Engineering, a research institute with the Agency for Science, Technology and Research in Singapore. He is also the current Technical Director of the Singapore Battery Consortium.

He is appointed the Deputy Executive Director of IMRE from December 2020. IMRE is a leading materials research institute in Singapore with over 300 research scientist and engineers that focus both on cutting edge science and translation efforts. Dr. Chiam has published Dr. Chiam was also the founding director for the Singapore Battery Consortium in Nov 2019. Currently, the consortium has >80 industry and >60 academic members, where he now serves as the consortium’s technical director.

Dr. Chiam was previously Adjunct Assistant Professor at Nanyang Technological University from 2012-2019, and Technology and Research Consultant for National Electric Vehicle Centre (NEVC) at Land Transport Authority (LTA) from 2021-2023. He also actively contributes to battery related activities across Singapore, for example, as technical advisors for industries, review panelist and battery standards development.
Registration and Collection of Course Materials, Welcome Remark (Lock Kai Sang), Programme Admin Brief (Ng Bor Kiat)
Fundamentals of EV Part 1 (Sin Jia Hau)
Fundamentals of EV Part 2 (Sin Jia Hau)
Power Electronics and Electric Motors (Akshay Kumar Rathore)
Drivetrains and Vehicle Control Systems (Zheng Jianxin)
Electric Vehicle Batteries, Application of Electric Vehicles, Autonomous Vehicles and Electric Mobility (Including Electrical Engineering and Safety)
Electric Vehicle Batteries, Safety Standards and Trends (Chiam Sing Yang)
Applications of Electric Vehicles (Chan Cher Leong)
Autonomous Vehicles and Electric Mobility (Chan Cher Leong)
Charging Infrastructure and Industry Visit (Hosted by Schneider Electric)
Land travel from SIT@Dover to Schneider Electric@50 Kallang Avenue
Final day of lecture and site visit to BYD
Land travel from SIT@Dover to BYD training centre at 60 Benoi Road
Hands on training on EV and simulators at BYD training centre (Chan Cher Leong)
Land travel from BD training centre to SIT@Dover
Advances in EV Powertrains (Prof William Cai Wei)
Installation engineering requirements of charging infrastructure and EV safety (Lock Kai Sang)
Assessment: group project presentation, current challenges/proposed solutions and open-ended problem-solving quiz (Lock Kai Sang and Ng Bor Kiat)
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who
Attend at least 75% of the course;
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The full fee for this course is S$5,450.00
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.

With the maritime industry turning to lower carbon fuels and energy-efficient technologies to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, the Masterclass in Maritime Decarbonisation offered by SIT steers knowledge acquisition in this direction.
Helping SMEs Embed Sustainability in Business

Co-developed with the Association of Small & Medium Enterprises (ASME), the ‘Introduction to Sustainability for Businesses’ course provides companies with the knowledge and frameworks for mapping their sustainability goals.

Explore elements that contribute to sustainable and resilient data centres, focusing on innovative technologies and strategies that ensure business continuity and minimise downtime during disruptions.
Building Services, Sustainability, Energy Efficiency, Executive Education
District Cooling Systems: Technologies, Components, and Sustainable Engineering
Learn the fundamentals of district cooling systems, including technologies, engineering principles, and sustainability strategies, to optimise efficiency and minimise environmental impact.
Sustainability, Energy Efficiency, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering
Green Transformation with Sustainability Excellence Associate (SEA) and B Corp Certification Process
Master sustainable business practices to boost operational performance, focusing on SEA and B Corp certifications for long-term growth and resilience.
Leadership and Communication, Business Management, Sustainability, Energy Efficiency
Machine Learning and AI Data Analytics for the Semiconductor Industry
Learn to address semiconductor manufacturing complexities with AI and ML and gain hands-on experience using Python programming.
Data Science and Analytics, AI and Machine Learning, Executive Education
Motor Driven Systems, Audit and Analysis
This course covers energy conservation opportunities for motor-driven equipment, including MDS design, system evaluation, and energy management programmes.
An executive programme that trains leaders in open source technology, risk management, and innovation, preparing them for Chief Open Source Officer roles.
